revised_title: Election Age Trends in the Royal Society
tldr: The article discusses the age of election to the Royal Society and how it has increased over time. It examines the median age of election in different scientific categories and the potential consequences of late elections on the influence of various subjects within the Society. The author also considers the purpose of election to the Fellowship and its impact on the scientific community.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
